definitions.body: byssus (late), (Ph. [[בוץ]], Aram. [[בּוּץ]], buws.; √ dub.; Birch, Wilkinson:Egyptians ii. 158 f. fr. Egypt. hbos, clothe; v. Say. Herodot:ii. 86; Thes fr. √ [[בוץ]], but Nö:ZMG 1875, 650; Armen., acc. to Lag:Sem. i. 72 al.) a fine white Egyptian linen, and cloth made of it, [[מִשְׁפְּחוֹת]] [[בֵּית־עֲבׂדַת הַבֻּץ]] 1Ch 4:21 families of the house of byssus-working; cf. 2Ch 2:13; [[מְכֻרְבָּל בִּמְעִיל בּוּץ]] 1Ch 15:27 clothed in a robe of byssus (but rd. rather as ‖ 2Sa 6:14 [[מְכַרְכֵּר בְּכָל־עׂז]] was dancing with all his might); cf. ´[[תַּכְרִיח בּ]] Es 8:15; [[מְלֻבָּשִׁים בּוּץ]] 2Ch 5:12; [[חַבְלֵי בוּץ]] Es 1:6, 2Ch 3:14 material of [[פָּרׂכֶת]]; article of trade Ez Eze 27:16 (del. LXX Co). Cf. also [[שֵׁשׁ]].
